newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares hit life peak for third day.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares hit life peak for third day.

text.p: The Norwegian stock exchange soared to the third record close in as many days on Friday buoyed by gains on major European bourses and Wall Street, dealers said.
The Oslo bourse finished at 1,154.46 points, up 0.65 percent from Thursday's all-time high.
Trade was brisk at 1.03 billion crowns.
Anglo-Norwegian construction and engineering group Kvaerner led the rise, its A share jumping 2.50 percent to 410 crowns in trade worth 80 million crowns.
Several analysts have upgraded their outlooks on Kvaerner since the company presented first-quarter profits a week ago that beat market expectations.
But industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, edged down 0.3 percent to 363.50 crowns as the week ended.
Hydro was the most traded share at 96 million crowns.
